paper.title:
Advances and Challenges in Foundation Agents: From Brain-Inspired
  Intelligence to Evolutionary, Collaborative, and Safe Systems
paper.summary:
The advent of large language models (LLMs) has catalyzed a transformative
shift in artificial intelligence, paving the way for advanced intelligent
agents capable of sophisticated reasoning, robust perception, and versatile
action across diverse domains. As these agents increasingly drive AI research
and practical applications, their design, evaluation, and continuous
improvement present intricate, multifaceted challenges. This survey provides a
comprehensive overview, framing intelligent agents within a modular,
brain-inspired architecture that integrates principles from cognitive science,
neuroscience, and computational research. We structure our exploration into
four interconnected parts. First, we delve into the modular foundation of
intelligent agents, systematically mapping their cognitive, perceptual, and
operational modules onto analogous human brain functionalities, and elucidating
core components such as memory, world modeling, reward processing, and
emotion-like systems. Second, we discuss self-enhancement and adaptive
evolution mechanisms, exploring how agents autonomously refine their
capabilities, adapt to dynamic environments, and achieve continual learning
through automated optimization paradigms, including emerging AutoML and
LLM-driven optimization strategies. Third, we examine collaborative and
evolutionary multi-agent systems, investigating the collective intelligence
emerging from agent interactions, cooperation, and societal structures,
highlighting parallels to human social dynamics. Finally, we address the
critical imperative of building safe, secure, and beneficial AI systems,
emphasizing intrinsic and extrinsic security threats, ethical alignment,
robustness, and practical mitigation strategies necessary for trustworthy
real-world deployment.

translation_title: 기초 에이전트의 발전과 도전 과제: 뇌 영감을 받은 지능에서 진화적, 협력적, 안전한 시스템까지
purpose: 고급 지능형 에이전트를 설계, 평가 및 지속적으로 개선하기 위한 도전 과제를 검토하여 뇌 영감을 받은 아키텍처를 통해 통합하는 것
method: 지능형 에이전트의 모듈형 기초를 탐구하고 인지, 지각 및 운영 모듈을 인간 뇌 기능에 대응시키는 체계적인 매핑 수행(First, we delve into the modular foundation of intelligent agents, systematically mapping their cognitive, perceptual, and operational modules onto analogous human brain functionalities.)

자동화된 최적화 패러다임을 통해 에이전트가 자율적으로 능력을 개선하고 동적 환경에 적응하는 방법 탐색(Second, we discuss self-enhancement and adaptive evolution mechanisms, exploring how agents autonomously refine their capabilities, adapt to dynamic environments.)

협력적이고 진화하는 다중 에이전트 시스템을 조사하고 인간 사회 역학과의 유사점 강조(Third, we examine collaborative and evolutionary multi-agent systems, investigating the collective intelligence emerging from agent interactions, cooperation, and societal structures.)
conclusion: 안전하고 신뢰할 수 있는 AI 시스템 창출을 위한 윤리적 정렬 및 위험 완화 전략을 강조하며, 현실 세계 적용을 위한 필수 요소들을 제시함.

paper.title:
Envisioning Beyond the Pixels: Benchmarking Reasoning-Informed Visual
  Editing
paper.summary:
Large Multi-modality Models (LMMs) have made significant progress in visual
understanding and generation, but they still face challenges in General Visual
Editing, particularly in following complex instructions, preserving appearance
consistency, and supporting flexible input formats. To address this gap, we
introduce RISEBench, the first benchmark for evaluating Reasoning-Informed
viSual Editing (RISE). RISEBench focuses on four key reasoning types: Temporal,
Causal, Spatial, and Logical Reasoning. We curate high-quality test cases for
each category and propose an evaluation framework that assesses Instruction
Reasoning, Appearance Consistency, and Visual Plausibility with both human
judges and an LMM-as-a-judge approach. Our experiments reveal that while
GPT-4o-Native significantly outperforms other open-source and proprietary
models, even this state-of-the-art system struggles with logical reasoning
tasks, highlighting an area that remains underexplored. As an initial effort,
RISEBench aims to provide foundational insights into reasoning-aware visual
editing and to catalyze future research. Though still in its early stages, we
are committed to continuously expanding and refining the benchmark to support
more comprehensive, reliable, and scalable evaluations of next-generation
multimodal systems. Our code and data will be released at
https://github.com/PhoenixZ810/RISEBench.

translation_title: 픽셀 너머의 상상: 추론 기반 시각 편집 벤치마킹
purpose: 복잡한 지침을 따르고 일관된 외관을 유지하며 유연한 입력 형식을 지원하는 시각 편집의 성능을 평가하려는 목표
method: RISEBench라는 첫 번째 벤치마크를 소개하여 추론 기반 시각 편집(RISE)을 평가(Given this gap, we introduce RISEBench, the first benchmark for evaluating Reasoning-Informed viSual Editing (RISE).)

각 카테고리에 대해 고품질 테스트 사례를 선별하고 평가 프레임워크를 제안하여 Instruction Reasoning, Appearance Consistency, Visual Plausibility를 인간 심사자와 LMM-심사자 접근 방식으로 평가함(We curate high-quality test cases for each category and propose an evaluation framework that assesses Instruction Reasoning, Appearance Consistency, and Visual Plausibility with both human judges and an LMM-as-a-judge approach.)

GPT-4o-Native가 다른 모델을 능가하지만 논리적 추론 과제에서 여전히 어려움을 겪는다는 실험 결과를 제시함(Our experiments reveal that while GPT-4o-Native significantly outperforms other open-source and proprietary models, even this state-of-the-art system struggles with logical reasoning tasks, highlighting an area that remains underexplored.)
conclusion: RISEBench는 추론 인식 시각 편집에 대한 기초적인 통찰을 제공하며, 다음 세대 다중모달 시스템의 평가를 더욱 포괄적이고 신뢰할 수 있게 할 수 있는 방향으로 지속적으로 확장 및 개선할 계획임.

paper.title:
GPT-ImgEval: A Comprehensive Benchmark for Diagnosing GPT4o in Image
  Generation
paper.summary:
The recent breakthroughs in OpenAI's GPT4o model have demonstrated
surprisingly good capabilities in image generation and editing, resulting in
significant excitement in the community. This technical report presents the
first-look evaluation benchmark (named GPT-ImgEval), quantitatively and
qualitatively diagnosing GPT-4o's performance across three critical dimensions:
(1) generation quality, (2) editing proficiency, and (3) world
knowledge-informed semantic synthesis. Across all three tasks, GPT-4o
demonstrates strong performance, significantly surpassing existing methods in
both image generation control and output quality, while also showcasing
exceptional knowledge reasoning capabilities. Furthermore, based on the
GPT-4o's generated data, we propose a classification-model-based approach to
investigate the underlying architecture of GPT-4o, where our empirical results
suggest the model consists of an auto-regressive (AR) combined with a
diffusion-based head for image decoding, rather than the VAR-like
architectures. We also provide a complete speculation on GPT-4o's overall
architecture. In addition, we conduct a series of analyses to identify and
visualize GPT-4o's specific limitations and the synthetic artifacts commonly
observed in its image generation. We also present a comparative study of
multi-round image editing between GPT-4o and Gemini 2.0 Flash, and discuss the
safety implications of GPT-4o's outputs, particularly their detectability by
existing image forensic models. We hope that our work can offer valuable
insight and provide a reliable benchmark to guide future research, foster
reproducibility, and accelerate innovation in the field of image generation and
beyond. The codes and datasets used for evaluating GPT-4o can be found at
https://github.com/PicoTrex/GPT-ImgEval.

translation_title: GPT-ImgEval: 이미지 생성을 위한 GPT-4o 진단의 종합 벤치마크
purpose: GPT-4o 모델의 이미지 생성 및 편집 능력을 정량적 및 정성적으로 평가하기 위한 벤치마크 개발
method: 세 가지 주요 차원에서 GPT-4o의 성능을 평가하기 위해 GPT-ImgEval 벤치마크를 제시함(We present the first-look evaluation benchmark (named GPT-ImgEval), quantitatively and qualitatively diagnosing GPT-4o's performance across three critical dimensions:)

GPT-4o의 이미지 생성 데이터에 기반하여 모델의 구조를 조사하기 위한 분류 모델 기반 접근 방식을 제안함(Furthermore, based on the GPT-4o's generated data, we propose a classification-model-based approach to investigate the underlying architecture of GPT-4o, where our empirical results suggest the model consists of an auto-regressive (AR) combined with a diffusion-based head for image decoding.)
GPT-4o와 Gemini 2.0 Flash 간의 다중 라운드 이미지 편집 비교 연구를 수행함(We also present a comparative study of multi-round image editing between GPT-4o and Gemini 2.0 Flash.)
conclusion: GPT-4o는 이미지 생성 및 편집에서 뛰어난 성능을 보이며, 향후 연구를 위한 신뢰할 수 있는 벤치마크와 통찰력을 제공한다.

paper.title:
Rethinking RL Scaling for Vision Language Models: A Transparent,
  From-Scratch Framework and Comprehensive Evaluation Scheme
paper.summary:
Reinforcement learning (RL) has recently shown strong potential in improving
the reasoning capabilities of large language models and is now being actively
extended to vision-language models (VLMs). However, existing RL applications in
VLMs often rely on heavily engineered frameworks that hinder reproducibility
and accessibility, while lacking standardized evaluation protocols, making it
difficult to compare results or interpret training dynamics. This work
introduces a transparent, from-scratch framework for RL in VLMs, offering a
minimal yet functional four-step pipeline validated across multiple models and
datasets. In addition, a standardized evaluation scheme is proposed to assess
training dynamics and reflective behaviors. Extensive experiments on visual
reasoning tasks uncover key empirical findings: response length is sensitive to
random seeds, reflection correlates with output length, and RL consistently
outperforms supervised fine-tuning (SFT) in generalization, even with
high-quality data. These findings, together with the proposed framework, aim to
establish a reproducible baseline and support broader engagement in RL-based
VLM research.

translation_title: 비전 언어 모델을 위한 RL 스케일링 재고: 투명하고 처음부터 만든 프레임워크 및 포괄적인 평가 계획
purpose: 비전 언어 모델에서 강화 학습(RL)의 재현 가능성을 높이고 평가 프로토콜을 표준화하여 연구 참여를 지원하기 위함
method: 비전 언어 모델을 위한 투명하고 기능적인 4단계 RL 프레임워크를 제안함(This work introduces a transparent, from-scratch framework for RL in VLMs, offering a minimal yet functional four-step pipeline validated across multiple models and datasets.)
표준화된 평가 방안을 제안하여 훈련 동역학 및 반사 행동을 평가하도록 함(In addition, a standardized evaluation scheme is proposed to assess training dynamics and reflective behaviors.)

시각적 추론 작업에 대한 광범위한 실험을 통해 주요 경험적 발견을 밝혀냄(Extensive experiments on visual reasoning tasks uncover key empirical findings: response length is sensitive to random seeds, reflection correlates with output length, and RL consistently outperforms supervised fine-tuning (SFT) in generalization, even with high-quality data.)
conclusion: 제안된 프레임워크와 발견된 결과는 RL 기반 비전 언어 모델 연구의 재현 가능한 기준을 구축하고, 보다 많은 연구 참여를 지원하는 데 기여함.

paper.title: Scaling Analysis of Interleaved Speech-Text Language Models
paper.summary:
Existing Speech Language Model (SLM) scaling analysis paints a bleak picture.
They predict that SLMs require much more compute and data compared to text,
leading some to question the feasibility of training high-quality SLMs.
However, modern SLMs are often initialised from pre-trained TextLMs using
speech-text interleaving to allow knowledge transfer. This raises the question
- Do interleaved SLMs scale more efficiently than textless-SLMs? In this paper
we answer a resounding, yes! We conduct scaling analysis of interleaved SLMs by
training several dozen and analysing the scaling trends. We see that under this
setup SLMs scale more efficiently with compute. Additionally, our results
indicate that the scaling-dynamics are significantly different than
textless-SLMs, suggesting one should allocate notably more of the compute
budget for increasing model size over training tokens. We also study the role
of synthetic data and TextLM model families in unlocking this potential.
Results suggest, that our scaled up model achieves comparable performance with
leading models on speech semantic metrics while using less compute and data
than other approaches. We open source models, samples, and data -
https://pages.cs.huji.ac.il/adiyoss-lab/sims.

purpose: 교차 언어 모델(SLM)이 데이터 없이도 더 효율적으로 스케일링되는지를 연구하기 위해.
method: 여러 개의 교차 SLM을 훈련시키고 스케일링 경향을 분석함(We conduct scaling analysis of interleaved SLMs by training several dozen and analysing the scaling trends.)
SLM이 컴퓨트 효율적으로 스케일링된다는 결과를 도출함(we see that under this setup SLMs scale more efficiently with compute.)

모델 크기를 늘리기 위해 훈련 토큰보다 컴퓨트 예산을 더 많이 할당해야 한다는 점을 강조함(additionally, our results indicate that the scaling-dynamics are significantly different than textless-SLMs, suggesting one should allocate notably more of the compute budget for increasing model size over training tokens.)
conclusion: 우리의 스케일업 모델은 기존 모델과 비교해 성능을 잃지 않으면서도 적은 컴퓨트와 데이터로 작업할 수 있다는 것을 보여줌.
